basics.name: Simeon Ogunbunmi
basics.label: Postdoctoral Researcher
basics.summary: Postdoctoral researcher in Electrical and Computer Engineering with a focus on security, edge computing, and UAV systems. My work integrates machine learning, blockchain, and cryptography to solve real-world problems in cyber-physical systems. Passionate about applied research, teaching, and collaborative innovation across disciplines.

work.name: Virginia State University
work.summary: Engineering OPC UA data pipeline using Prosys UA Client and Python to aggregate data from DMG MORI (DMU50) and environmental sensors, streaming processed data to Azure cloud for centralized storage and analysis.
highlights: Building real-time dashboard with OPC UA client integration to visualize machine and energy metrics
Utilizing Python for data preprocessing and synchronization across sensor inputs
Enhancing data integrity and preparing datasets for advanced analytics on Azure

work.name: Binghamton University
work.summary: Conducted research in Intelligent and Sustainable Edge Computing (I-SEC) Lab focusing on UAV security, blockchain technology, and edge computing systems.
highlights: Developed reputation system for 5 UAVs using blockchain technology, ensuring security of 60% of datasets collected
Created Python-based remote application for UAV telemetry with authenticated data exchange protocols
Enhanced UAV data collection using Raspberry PI hardware, reducing data compromise by over 30%

work.name: Hub Control
work.summary: Engineered secure, Python-based remote-control platform for IoT heat pumps with cloud-based authentication and real-time system validation.
highlights: Integrated cloud-based authentication and secure scripting using Raspberry Pi sensors
Led collaborative effort resulting in 30% improvement in response times for system alerts
Optimized infrastructure resulting in 30% increase in system efficiency

volunteer.summary: Organized educational events involving multiple elementary schools and developed lesson plans aligned with educational standards.
highlights: Organized events bringing together students from different schools for educational activities
Collaborated with teachers to develop and implement effective lesson plans

publications.name: A lightweight reputation system for uav networks
publications.summary: Proposes a LIghtweight Blockchain-based REputation (LIBRE) system to improve the reliability and performance of a UAV network by monitoring, tracking, and selecting the most appropriate individuals to carry out tasks.

publications.name: A survey on reputation systems for uav networks
publications.summary: Presents an exhaustive survey of trust and reputation systems, exploring existing frameworks and proposed innovations alongside their inherent challenges in UAV networks.

publications.name: Interest Flooding Attacks in Named Data Networking and Mitigations: Recent Advances and Challenges
publications.summary: Examines research advances in Interest Flooding Attack detection and mitigation in Named Data Networking from 2013 to 2024.
